required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Zinc Status and Growth in Cystic Fibrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Zinc Status and Growth in Cystic Fibrosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to improve the understanding of the relationship of zinc status and growth in infants and young children who were diagnosed with cystic fibrosis via newborn screening.

detailed_description.textblock:
The objective of this study is to improve the understanding of the relationship of zinc (Zn) status and growth in infant and young people with cystic fibrosis (PWCF). The investigators hypothesize that Zn deficiency in infant and young PWCF is associated with poor growth.
Aim #2: To study the association between Zn levels in red blood cells and nutritional status in PWCF at 3 months to 3 years of age and compare it to the association between serum Zn and nutritional status in the same population. Hypothesis: Lower Zn levels in red blood cells is associated with poorer nutritional status in infant and young PWCF and is a better measure of Zn status compared to serum Zn.

primary_outcome.description: Zn status in infant and young PWCF as measured by serum Zn and red blood cell Zn

arm_group.description: Pediatric patients ages 3 months to 3 years with CF identified via newborn screening.

intervention.description: The investigators will obtain an additional 2 mL of blood in an extra tube. This will be collected at the same time blood is collected for the participant's yearly CF screening labs so as to minimize additional needle sticks.

If the participant is greater or equal than 5 kg, an additional 2 mL of blood will be obtained in an extra tube. This will be collected at the same time blood is collected for the participant's yearly CF screening labs so as to minimize additional needle sticks.

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric patients ages 3 months to 3 years with CF identified via new born screening

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients ages 3 months to 3 years with CF identified via new born screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of meconium ileus
- History of prematurity (born prior to completing 36 weeks 6 days gestation)

facility.name: Riley Hospital for Children at Indiana University Health

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Cystic Fibrosis Center & Professor, School of Medicine
